intro: Elaeoselinum cuatrecasasii, commonly known as the Canary Islands fennel, is a rare and endemic plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal habitats, showcasing adaptations to the island's unique climate. Its leaves are finely divided and emit a mild anise-like scent, while its flowers are small and white. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
